intro: Lippia strigulosa, commonly known as rough lippia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
